title: Journal of a Summer Tour in the Perthshire and Inverness-shire Highlands
author: Roger, James Cruikshank.
snippet: There is a stone of like character at Pitfourie,the field in front of Baledmund, which Mr.Fergusson informed me, had been one of a circlewhich was carted away by one of his father'stenants, during the absence of the family.

title: Journal of a Summer Tour in the Perthshire and Inverness-shire Highlands
author: Roger, James Cruikshank.
snippet: Thursday, June \0th.—Remained in the houseto write up my journal, and in the afternooncalled at Baledmund, but did not find Mr. or Mrs.Fergusson at home.

title: Journal of a Summer Tour in the Perthshire and Inverness-shire Highlands
author: Roger, James Cruikshank.
snippet: The waggonette which brought us to Baledmundreturned at 10.30 p.in , when we drove toParkcroy.

title: Journal of a Summer Tour in the Perthshire and Inverness-shire Highlands
author: Roger, James Cruikshank.
snippet: Mrs.Fergusson, the elder of Baledmund, and herdaughter, Mrs. Mossman, called upon us in theevening.

title: Journal of a Summer Tour in the Perthshire and Inverness-shire Highlands
author: Roger, James Cruikshank.
snippet: In theafternoon, Mrs. Fergusson the elder ofBaledmund, and her daughter Mrs. Mossman,called upon us.

title: Journal of a Summer Tour in the Perthshire and Inverness-shire Highlands
author: Roger, James Cruikshank.
snippet: In the after-noon, Mr. and Mrs. Grant-Fergusson, ofBaledmund, called upon us.
